name: Aaron P. Sykes

accomplishments: Deprecated MongoDB, and migrated platform usage data to PostgreSQL using JSONB field
Maintained and optimized code for collecting, enriching, and aggregating customer audience data
Exposed customer business logic to internal services via REST API, and RPC over Protobuf server/client
Developed various services for routing platform usage data to third party Cloud SAAS products
Transitioned customer audience data collection service from a single REST API source to a dual source with REST API and RPC over Protobuf
Managed services running in GCP and AWS environments
Designed and developed a multitude of new features for a multi-tenanted web app and REST API
Implemented numerous UI changes and customizations using Javascript, HTML, and CSS
Utilized test-driven development methods by writing numerous automated unit and integration tests
Performed server administration tasks on multiple AWS EC2 instances running Nginx, uWSGI, and PostgreSQL
Optimized PostgreSQL database performance using Python database utilities
Built a project health web app using Python and JavaScript, and deployed on Google App Engine
Developed an application for displaying web traffic data using python, Google App Engine, OAuth 2.0, and the Google API Client
Implemented numerous Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager JavaScript implementations
Reduced the time required to perform a weekly analysis of the business opportunity pipeline using an enterprise Database Management System
Facilitated the movement of medical records from servers at various Veteran Health Administration data hubs to a single data warehouse
Detected the cause of data quality issues within a wireless device datastore for the DIA's IT Commodity Office

additionalInfo: Experienced with all phases of software development including: planning, implementation, and support; worked on projects that used an Agile development methodology; maintain Linux desktops and servers for personal and professional use; used Git and SVN; employed data management and statistics skills in all of my jobs; comfortable with web standards: JSON, HTML5, and CSS.
